Title: Production controlling for matured field of oil and gas company
Source title: International Journal of Mechanical Engineering and Technology
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sofyan, Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Girsang, A.S., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The high decline rate and the low and off are challenge for the oil and gas companies as matured oil-fields operator. This research was conducted to provide a solution to obtain information about the dominant factors which cause low and off. The data warehouse can be a solution in analyzing data and getting information about the dominant factors causing low and off, faster and more accurately. This research uses the data from the operational database and daily production reports that are already exist. The method used in this research is a nine-step methodology designed by Kimball and Ross which is a model of systematic data warehouse in building data warehouse. The output of this research is a prototype data warehouse that can be used to perform an analysis in helping the management team to make decision in production planning process. The conclusion of this research is that data warehouse can be a solution for oil and gas company to obtain valuable information from historical data or from other data sources that have been available, but not yet maximally utilized, such as information of dominant factors causing low and off. © IAEME Publication
Author Keywords: Data Warehouse; Low; Matured Field; Off; Oil and Gas

Authors: Winda A., Sofyan, Sthevany, Vincent R.S.
Title: Intelligent Automatic Right-Left Sign Lamp Based on Brain Signal Recognition System
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Kemanggisan, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Winda, A., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Kemanggisan, 11480, Indonesia; Sofyan, Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Kemanggisan, 11480, Indonesia; Sthevany, Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Kemanggisan, 11480, Indonesia; Vincent, R.S., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Kemanggisan, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Comfort as a part of the human factor, plays important roles in nowadays advanced automotive technology. Many of the current technologies go in the direction of automotive driver assistance features. However, many of the driver assistance features still require physical movement by human to enable the features. In this work, the proposed method is used in order to make certain feature to be functioning without any physical movement, instead human just need to think about it in their mind. In this work, brain signal is recorded and processed in order to be used as input to the recognition system. Right-Left sign lamp based on the brain signal recognition system can potentially replace the button or switch of the specific device in order to make the lamp work. The system then will decide whether the signal is 'Right' or 'Left'. The decision of the Right-Left side of brain signal recognition will be sent to a processing board in order to activate the automotive relay, which will be used to activate the sign lamp. Furthermore, the intelligent system approach is used to develop authorized model based on the brain signal. Particularly Support Vector Machines (SVMs)-based classification system is used in the proposed system to recognize the Left-Right of the brain signal. Experimental results confirm the effectiveness of the proposed intelligent Automatic brain signal-based Right-Left sign lamp access control system. The signal is processed by Linear Prediction Coefficient (LPC) and Support Vector Machines (SVMs), and the resulting experiment shows the training and testing accuracy of 100% and 80%, respectively. © 2017 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Author Keywords: brain signal; human factor; Linear Prediction Coding (LPC); Support Vector Machines (SVMs)
Index Keywords: Access control; Automobile drivers; Human engineering; Intelligent systems; Signal processing; Speech recognition; Automotive technology; Brain signals; Classification system; Linear prediction coding; Linear prediction coefficients; Recognition systems; Support vector machine (SVMs); Training and testing; Support vector machines

Authors: Wajong A.M.R., Khristian Edi N.S., Sofyan, Meilani
Title: Information system of cloud computing, integrated with a communication system on the robot-supporting urban search and rescue in disaster areas
Affiliations: Department of Industrial Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Department of Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Department of Civil Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wajong, A.M.R., Department of Industrial Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Khristian Edi, N.S., Department of Industrial Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Sofyan, Department of Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Meilani, Department of Civil Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Disasters occur oftenly in Indonesia, where its management is still intact from the application of technology, particularly information technology. Efforts of relief conducted for the victims are still very conventional. Meanwhile, the development of information technology has advanced considerably and can be applied to help the victims with the creation of robots that can get inside crevices of the buildings which are damaged due to disasters. Moreover, the implementation of cloud computing technology allows interested experts to not attend the site of disaster, making this technology very useful. The applied technology is also very environmentally friendly as it will very much be able to preserve the environment which results in significantly immense benefits for the safety of the victims. © Medwell Journals, 2014.
Author Keywords: Cloud computing; Disaster; Information technology; Robots; Victims

Authors: Soebandrija K.E.N., Wajong A.M.R., Meilani, Sofyan
Title: Indonesia situation and perspective: Urban Search and Rescue (USAR) within Emergency Response Systems in Confined Space Disaster
Source title: International Journal of Applied Engineering Research

Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Meilani, Civil Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Syahdan Campus, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Sofyan, Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Syahdan Campus, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper constitutes the discussion of Urban Search and Rescue (USAR) from Indonesia Situation and Perspectives, within Emergency Response Systems (ERS) in Confined Space Disaster (CSD). This paper constitutes the continuation of future research of prior International Conferences and Journals that were presented and /or will be published by Soebandrija, Wajong, Meilani and Sofyan (2013) that are multidiscipline views of Industrial, Computer, and Civil Engineering. Yet, there are several novelty and new discussions in this paper. First, as the background of this paper and prior papers: a. as overview, is to conduct research of USAR in any places in the world that happened in Confined Space Disaster, and that are Searched and Rescued using Serpentine Robot; b. as focus on this paper is to elaborate the Indonesia Situation and Perspectives to enrich the ERS and CSD Managements pertaining the similarities and differences of Indonesia Situation as compared to other countries’ situations. Furthermore, as the specific background, The geographical position of Indonesia is at the confluence of three major plates of the world (Australia, Eurasia and the Pacific) and nine other small plates. This position added to the situation that Indonesia is located at ring of fire position, having more than 66 volcanoes. This condition also causes the volcanic earthquake and vulnerable to the Disaster Situation that require ERS and CSD. Second, as the objective of this paper is to assess and have the lesson learned from the mentioned similarities and differences, to ameliorate the Disaster Control and Management in current and future occurrence in Indonesia and abroad. Third, as the methodology in this paper constitutes observation, field visit and collaboration with the all experts in Government and Civilian’s Key Person. In addition to the field visit and collaboration, in this paper there is laboratory experiment as relate to production of prototype and final product, as relate to prior papers that discussed serpentine robot for prototype and ongoing development for the improvement for the final serpentine products. Fourth, the audience of this paper are the Government and Civilian and related person involved in ERS and CSD Management to have improved skills and collaboration to handle the situation with safety consideration for the rescuers and the victims. Fourth, as the result, this paper provides the Indonesia situation and perspectives, and its guidance for the ERS and CSD. Fifth, as the conclusion, this paper is beneficial to enhance the prior research, and to trigger further continuous improvement for constantly changing and challenging ERS and CSD, not only in Indonesia but also in other countries. © Research India Publications.
Author Keywords: Confined space rescue; Emergency Response Systems; Government and civilian collaboration; Indonesia; Serpentine robot

Title: A camera-based autonomous mobile robot on a simple simulated highway
Source title: Proceedings - International Conference on Instrumentation, Communication, Information Technology and Biomedical Engineering 2011, ICICI-BME 2011
Affiliations: Electrical Engineering, Universitas Pelita Harapan (UPH), Tangerang, 15811, Indonesia; Computer Engineering, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Marcellino, B.A., Electrical Engineering, Universitas Pelita Harapan (UPH), Tangerang, 15811, Indonesia; Kuantama, E., Electrical Engineering, Universitas Pelita Harapan (UPH), Tangerang, 15811, Indonesia; Sofyan, Computer Engineering, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The automatic car steering technology has the potential to reduce the rate of traffic accidents, in the future. As a starting point, in this research a mobile robot, which can run between two road lines using a camera is designed. To detect the road lines in the image from the camera, Edge Detection and Line Detection method is used. The kernel used in the Edge Detection method is the Sobel kernel. The Line Detection is done by finding the coordinates of the maximum value for each column in the Edge Detection's image result. The intersection of two lines will show a certain direction of the robot to correct its direction of movement. Both methods are implemented on a wheeled mobile robot that is controlled by a microcontroller. The robot can detect the miniature road lines and correct its direction of movement so that it can run between the two road lines in parallel with the lines. © 2011 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Automatic control; Edge Detection; Line Detection; Microcontroller; Sobel kernel
Index Keywords: Autonomous Mobile Robot; Edge detection methods; Line detection; Maximum values; Sobel kernel; Two-line; Wheeled mobile robot; Automation; Biomedical engineering; Cameras; Communication; Control; Edge detection; Highway accidents; Highway traffic control; Information technology; Microcontrollers; Mobile robots; Roads and streets; Transportation
